docs.lead_paragraph: A woman accused of killing her newborn daughter was unaware of her pregnancy and has no memory of giving birth, her lawyer said in State Supreme Court yesterday. The woman, Laura Sergio, 25, has been charged with second-degree murder. The police found the baby, who was said to have died of hypothermia and asphyxiation, on the back porch of the family home in Bay Ridge on April 7. In an interview, a lawyer for Ms. Sergio, Thomas Cascione, described the case as “a classic neonaticide,” a term used to describe the killing of a baby by the mother within 24 hours of birth. In such cases, the mother is generally in denial of her pregnancy. Ms. Sergio was ordered held without bail.

headline.main: Brooklyn: Woman’s Defense in Baby’s Death
